% This is an example exam file written in RMarkdown using the examClass package.

\checkboxchar{$\Box$}
\checkedchar{$\blacksquare$}
\addpoints

% ---------- Exam class options ---------- %

%\printanswers



% Set the format of the question numbers and titles.  "thequestion" is the question number and "thequestiontitle" is the question title or the question number if the question is untitled. "conditionalQuestionTitle" is the question title if the question is titled, and empty otherwise.

\qformat{%
  \textbf{\thequestion.}%
  \textit{ \conditionalQuestionTitle}\hfill (\totalpoints\ points in total)
}
% Set the page style to have a header and footer.
\pagestyle{headandfoot}
\footer{}{Page \thepage\ of \pageref*{LastPage}}{}

% Add a grading table.

\gradetable[v][questions]


% Optional content that is only printed if answers are printed.
\ifprintanswers
% Whatever is inside here will only be printed if answers are printed.
**Solutions**
\fi

% Optional content that is printed only if answers are not printed.
\ifprintanswers
\else
% Whatever is inside here will only be printed if answers are not printed.
\begin{center}
Instructions for students:
Here are some instructions.
\end{center}
\fi

\vspace{0.5cm}


\begin{questions}

\question[5]



The following are true/false questions.


\begin{true_false_questions}[Statement]
\tfitem{This is a true/false question}{T}
\tfitem{This is another true/false question}{F}
\end{true_false_questions}




\titledquestion{This is a question}

This is a **general** question.
\begin{parts}
\part[3]
This is a part.

\begin{multicolcheckboxes}
\choice This is a choice
\CorrectChoice This is **another** choice
\choice This is yet another choice
\end{multicolcheckboxes}
\part
This part has subparts.
\begin{subparts}
\subpart[2]
This is a subpart. I can *even* include _LaTeX_ or math ($E=mc^2$) in my subparts. I can <ins>underline</ins> text, too!
\subpart
This subpart has subsubparts! 
\begin{subsubparts}
\subsubpart[1]
\fillin[T] The world is all that is the case.
This is a subsubpart.
\subsubpart[4]
Another subsubpart.
\end{subsubparts}
\end{subparts}
\end{parts}



{{< include Questions/Course_Load.qmd >}}

\newpage

{{< include Questions/Cough_Syrup.qmd >}}

\newpage



\end{questions}
